stories.text:
This is an example of some support tickets that are now starting to float around. Does anyone have the "Google Translate" on this? Examples of support tickets:

I am a resident of Alabama. I am curious about your process for responding to California Consumer Privacy Act data access requests:

1) What information do you provide in response to a CCPA data access request?

2) Do you process CCPA data access requests via email, a website, or telephone? If via a website, what is the URL I should go to?

3) Would you process a CCPA data access request from me even though I am not a resident of California?

4) What personal information do I have to submit for you to verify and process a CCPA data access request?

To be clear, I am not submitting a data access request at this time. My questions are about your process for when I do submit a request.

Thanks for your answers to these questions I have.

I look forward to your replies without undue delay and at most within 35 days of this email, as required by Section 1798.130 of the California Civil Code.
stories.title: Ask HN: Weird Support Tickets on CCPA
Apple Park: first look at the design team shaping the future of tech

stories.text: Hi, I guess this is just yet another instance of some content farm producing highly addictive videos. But go to Youtube (in private browsing mode) and search for Cake Stories, Cake Storytime or something similar. Hundreds of videos will appear that are all very similar. They are all timelaps videos of cakes/desserts being prepared while a young female voices tells a story about some high school drama, troubles with parents or some college incident. Has anybody else seen those and finds those troubling?
stories.title: Ask HN: Is YouTube being flooded by Cake+Story Videos?
Founding Team vs. Solo Founder, Which Is Better?
Can We Even Put Human Stories in Video Games Anyway?
